#Load the librarys
import pandas as pd #To work with dataset
import numpy as np #Math library
import seaborn as sns #Graph library that use matplot in background
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt #to plot some parameters in seaborn
# Read spreadsheet and assign it to swiss_loan
swiss_loan= pd.read_excel('../input/loan-credit-risk/ATUCE_Case_study_data_2021.xlsx')

n, bins, patches = plt.hist(x=swiss_loan['Montant'], bins='auto', color='blue',alpha=0.7, rwidth=0.5)
plt.xlabel("Loan Amount")
plt.show()

source.bf48298a:
# Create a cross table of the loan intent and loan status
t1=pd.crosstab(swiss_loan['Niveauderisque'], swiss_loan['Pays_correct'], margins = True)
H=t1/t1.loc["All"] # Divide by column totals
H.style.background_gradient()
source.d161e047:
red = sns.light_palette("red", as_cmap=True)
cross_tab=pd.crosstab(swiss_loan['Niveauderisque'], swiss_loan['effectifs_correct'], margins = True)
H=cross_tab/cross_tab.loc["All"] # Divide by column totals
H.style.background_gradient(cmap=red)
source.811e93e8:

plt.title('Average Percent capital  by Loan Status')
